title: Newton's First Law — Inertia
content:
Newton's First Law — Inertia

The Hook

Did you know that the physics of newton's first law — inertia is at work all around you — even in a simple kite flying? In this lesson we uncover the science behind it.

The Concept

Newton's First Law — Inertia is a fundamental topic in Newton's Laws. Understanding it helps explain everyday phenomena and forms the basis of many engineering applications. The key idea is that physical quantities follow predictable mathematical relationships that scientists have verified through careful experiments in labs just like your school lab.

The Illustration

Consider a kite flying: the physics of newton's first law — inertia governs its behaviour directly. Engineers and scientists across India — from ISRO scientists in Bengaluru to factory engineers in Pune — apply these principles daily. By mastering this concept, you are building the same mental toolkit they use. Practice the five quiz questions below to test your understanding!
